The NACOSA OVC Community Systems Strengthening (NACOSA’s OVC CSS) project improves the well-being of families and their vulnerable children through comprehensive and coordinated interventions to strengthen the capacity of families and communities to care for OVC in districts with high prevalence and high maternal mortality. The OVC CSS project fosters an enabling environment to facilitate community networks, linkages and partnerships for improved OVC service delivery in selected districts of six provinces. This project includes: resources and capacity building of 30 OVC community organizations to provide improved community activities, service delivery and referrals; and, organizational and leadership strengthening to enhance monitoring, evaluation and learning. Activities consist of: building community capacity by strengthening Child Care Forums and Child Protection Forums and participating in District AIDS Councils; training child and youth care workers and family caregivers; for improved OVC services; facilitating sub-district planning; and, promoting improved technical information sharing (e.g. HIV prevention, grief workshops and sexual and reproductive health information).This project will seek to improve referrals and linkages for support and access to ART treatment, sexual and reproductive health services, and nutritional referrals for families caring for OVC. M &E plans for all activities implemented by the 30 sub partners are regularly monitored to ensure outcomes are achieved. A situational analysis to ensure baseline data is available is underway. NACOSA is working with their CBOs to ensure linkages and support from the SAG and aims to ensure their program is cost efficient and effective in achieving improved outcomes for OVC and their families.
